title.native: もめんたりー・リリィ

description:
Robotic invaders wiped out all life, but Renge fights to survive using her powers. With no memories, she roams the city until she meets five other young women, each with unique abilities. Together, they make the most of their lives, cooking delicious meals between battles with mechanical monstrosities. As they uncover the secrets of their powers and pasts, they find strength in their friendship.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
hashtag: #もめりり #もめんたりーリリィ

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

もめんたりー・リリィ 続いていく割烹、割烹！

node.description: __Kudou Susumu__ is a director and storyboard artist.
Katsumasa Yokomine is an animator and director.

Shingo Suzuki is an animator previously belonging to Gonzo and Satelight and now affiliated with GoHands.  He was being influenced by Masami Obari and Fumihide Sai and is particularly known for his bold and peculiar shading and high level drawings.

Shingo Suzuki is an animator previously belonging to Gonzo and Satelight and now affiliated with GoHands.  He was being influenced by Masami Obari and Fumihide Sai and is particularly known for his bold and peculiar shading and high level drawings.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.

Affiliated with [GoHands](https://anilist.co/studio/309/).

Often miscredited as Makoto Yoshida (吉田誠).
Originally from Studio Wanpack. Currently affiliated with [GoHands](https://anilist.co/studio/309/).

__Genres:__ Metal (Metalcore)

__[Website](https://hanabie.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://x.com/HA_NA_BIE_)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100090249012483)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ha_na_bie_/)__


__Introduction:__
"Hanabie.", stylized as "HANABIE.", is a four-piece, all-female Japanese metal group, signed to Epic Records Japan, a subsidiary of Sony Music Entertainment Japan. Their style is described as "Harajuku-core".

__Biography:__
The band was formed in 2015 by four high school friends due to their admiration of [Maximum the Hormone](https://anilist.co/staff/101206/Maximum-the-Hormone). They began by doing covers, but they quickly started writing original music, self-producting their first singles named "Crash Over" and "Sweet Killer" in 2016. In 2018, they released their first mini-album "Cherry Blossoms Are Blooming", and in 2021, they released the song "We Love Sweets", which gathered over a million views on YouTube. Later that year, they released their first album named "Girl's Reform Manifest". In January 2023, they released the single "Osaki ni Shitsureishimasu." ("Pardon Me, I Have To Go Now"), which attracted the attention of international promoters. In June 2023, during the Japanese music festival "Satanic Carnival", they announced that they had signed with Epic Records Japan. Shortly after that, they released their second album named "Raise wa Ijin!" ("Reborn Superstar!").


__Members:__
Yukina (ユキナ) – Harsh and clean vocals (2015–)
Matsuri (マツリ) – Guitar and clean vocals (2015–)
Hettsu (ヘッツ) – Bass and chorus (2015–)
Chika (チカ) – Drums (2023–)


__Former Members:__
Kaede (カエデ) - Drums (2015-2016)
Boa (ボア) - Drums (2017-2018)
Sae (サエ) - Drums (2020-2023)

[Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%AB%98%E6%A9%8B%E6%95%8F%E5%BC%98)

President and CEO of Shouchiku Co Ltd.
